meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Jim Ryan Bev Praver Chris Walkey Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #611.

td.p: Jim Ryan, a writer from Alexandria, Virginia
Bev Praver, an entertaining educator from Covina, California
Chris Walkey, a jeweler originally from Boston, Massachusetts (whose 2-day cash winnings total $14,801)

tr.td: TRAINS
MONEY
STARTS WITH "P"
FAMOUS NAPOLEONS
DISNEYLAND
HONDURAS
[Alex mentioned the category's clues had not been selected in two previous games.]

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'By improving the railroad sleeping car, he managed to get it named after him')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: By improving the railroad sleeping car, he managed to get it named after him

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_2_1', 'clue_J_2_1_stuck', 'From the Latin "duplus", meaning double, this Spanish coin was used in America until the 1800s')

toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Alex: [When Jim selected the clue in that category] Okay!)

Jim
')

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_1_2', 'clue_J_1_2_stuck', '(Bev: What is a steam train?)
(Alex: [sees Jim attempting to ring in] Jim, do you think you know?)
(Jim: [*].)
[The song does not play going into the break.]

"Last Train to Clarksville"

Bev
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_2', 'clue_J_1_2_stuck', '[AUDIO DAILY DOUBLE] This was the 1st No. 1 Hit for "The Monkees": "Cause I\'m leaving in the morning / And I must see you again / We\'ll have one more night together / Till the morning brings my train and I must go / Oh, no, no, no / Oh, no, no, no"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: [AUDIO DAILY DOUBLE] This was the 1st No. 1 Hit for "The Monkees": "Cause I'm leaving in the morning / And I must see you again / We'll have one more night together / Till the morning brings my train and I must go / Oh, no, no, no / Oh, no, no, no"

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
